text:
you are going to have a super tough time achieving this through native search. You would either need to index your pages a specific way and use an outside search. Another option woulld be to load up these types of options in hubdb, and index your pages, returning the content based on that.

There might be some other solutions, but all would require some use of a different method then normal native search.  check here for what you can do <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>

Depending on how the landing page is built, andi fyou are just using a flex column in both templaets, you could try replacing the new code into the current template and make the switch like that.

If the code/template doesnâ€™t match up like that, you might try the api, but overall I think manual is going to be the way to go.

Yeah, I made a duplicate of the theme and started swapping out the templates (about 15 or so at that point) when I was curious if there was a way to bulk switch but I guess not. Thanks for your response <@U25PYL3Q8>
